conbody.p: MapR FS File Metadata executorchanging metadataYou can configure the MapR FS File Metadata executor to remove a file or directory from MapR FS after receiving an event.

For example, say you run a daily pipeline that writes data to MapR FS. You can use the MapR FS File Metadata executor to remove the target directory and all of its contents before a pipeline starts processing data. Simply configure the pipeline to pass the pipeline start event to an MapR FS File Metadata executor, then specify the target directory when you configure the executor. For more information about using pipeline events, see .
Remove directories with caution. The executor removes directories recursively, deleting any subdirectories and their contents in addition to the specified directory.
